message: After I get off the phone, I explain what happened to Mizuki and dash over to Delivery Works.

According to Ms. Yoshie, Granny collapsed on her way to a patient's house to deliver some medicine.

She was near Delivery Works when it happened, so they brought her there.
I run as fast as my legs will carry me. My heart is pounding and I'm out of breath. Adrenaline makes my toes and fingers tingle.
Granny's collapsed from overwork before.
Back then, it was my fault, because I made her worry.
I remember how I trembled with fear at the thought of losing her.
I never want to feel like that again.
I have to get there faster!
Granny!

name: タエ
message: "You're all making a big deal out of nothing."
That's the first thing out of her mouth when I burst through the door of Delivery Works.
Granny is leaning back in a chair. When I see that she's alright, my legs almost give out beneath me.
It turns out that Granny just threw out her back. That's why she collapsed. It wasn't a stroke or anything.
The way Ms. Yoshie described it, it sounded like something far more serious. She apologizes profusely after I arrive.
To be honest, it does feel a bit anti-climactic, but I'm just glad she's alright.
That said, Granny can't walk yet, so I have to carry her home.

name: タエ
message: "Really, you're all overreacting."
Granny complains from her perch atop my back.
I walk slowly, to avoid jostling her too much.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Well, what do you expect? We all worry about you. Myself included."

name: タエ
message: "I'm still plenty healthy, thank you very much."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I know that, but still."
Ren patters along behind us.

name: タエ
message: "I get a little stiff and you start acting like I'm on my deathbed."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ow! Don't kick me! Anyway, let's go to the hospital tomorrow? Please?"
Granny's age isn't about to stop her from throwing a tantrum. The last thing I want is to drop her.
Though, you know... Granny's pretty light.
I've always had this image of her towering over me. Was she always this small?
Plus, this is the first time I've carried her on my back like this.

name: 蒼葉
message: "You used to be the one who carried me around."

name: タエ
message: "Hmm?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Just, you know, reminiscing about the past."

name: タエ
message: "...Hmph. I had to do that because you'd always wander off."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'd wander off?"

name: タエ
message: "Oh yes. I'd take my eye off you for a second and you'd be gone."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Really? I don't remember that."

name: タエ
message: "You were probably just lonely."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Lonely? What makes you think that?"

name: タエ
message: "Because you only started doing it after your parents left."
Right. I only have vague memories of my parents.
But I do remember how Granny used to carry me on her back.
Her smell and her warmth made me feel so safe.

name: タエ
message: "Well, it's understandable. You were pretty little back then. But now you've gone and gotten stupidly big."

name: 蒼葉
message: "It'd be weirder if I hadn't changed."

name: タエ
message: "Who said you shouldn't change?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Could you carry me on your back again, just for old time's sake? Why not give it a shot while you've still got your health?"

name: タエ
message: "Don't be ridiculous. Are you trying to kill me?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Just kidding."

name: タエ
message: "Hmph."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Granny."

name: タエ
message: "What?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "You sure are light."

name: タエ
message: "Shut your piehole!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ouch!"
She slaps me upside the head, hard.
But it makes me happy, for some reason. I smile to myself.
I'm so glad Granny was okay.
It makes me sad to think that one day, she might not be there to smack me or yell at me anymore.
I walk quietly down the darkening street, feeling her warmth against my back.
